meanings.definition: Annoyingly persistent in urging or criticizing
meanings.sent1: The nags voice kept reminding me to finish my homework.
meanings.sent2: She is always the nags one in our group, never letting us forget anything.
meanings.sent3: The nags alarm clock made sure I woke up on time every morning.
meanings.sent4: The nags sound of the dripping faucet echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent5: The nags teacher always pointed out every mistake in our work.

meanings.definition: A person who constantly complains or finds fault
meanings.sent1: My aunt is such a nags when it comes to cleanliness.
meanings.sent2: The nags at the office always has something to grumble about.
meanings.sent3: The nags at the party kept whining about the music being too loud.
meanings.sent4: The nags in the neighborhood never seems satisfied with anything.
meanings.sent5: The nags in the family always brings up old grievances during gatherings.

meanings.definition: To annoy or irritate by persistent faultfinding or complaining
meanings.sent1: She nags her brother to clean up his room every day.
meanings.sent2: The customer continued to nag the waiter about the wrong order.
meanings.sent3: The cat nags at the door when it wants to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The wind nags at the loose shutters, creating a rhythmic noise.
meanings.sent5: The child nags at his parents until they agree to buy him a new toy.
